measured_by: random binary choice task (200 key-press trials)
justification: The author links "how capable humans are of behaving randomly" to the present study in which "each subject complete[d] 200 trials" choosing between two identical options, using those choice sequences to gauge randomness.

Response latency is analyzed as an index of how quickly decisions were made: "Figure 2 shows the distribution of per-subject sums of response times… the mean of the individual per-trial response times… is 296 ms; the median is 179 ms."
